intro: Uvaria rovumae, commonly known as the Rovuma uvaria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Tanzania and Mozambique. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
